column4: Why can't I get the changes I make to this mp3 file's tags "stick" in Rhythmbox? The file permissions are set to read & write... it is only 2 files out of a group of 16 that are giving me this issue - all the others stayed changed when I edited their tags. I don't see how these two are any different. It is driving me crazy.. aaaarrgghh!!
can you pastebin the output of ls -la in the folder where the mp3's are?
here is the output - as you can see all permissions are the same - http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/VckRDkJu - (sorry I keep getting disconnected from the internet, my connection is being suck)
and which files are giving you problems?
track 15 and track 16 only.
I mean, number 18 and 19 in the pastebin
hmm..not 11, 12 ? the only two with ' in the titles?
ok.. they look like the rest to me.. strange.. have you tried running rhythmbox from a terminal just to see if it prints out any kind of error message when you try changing the tags?
nope
no.
if that doesn't work I would try another tag editor.. easytag is quite ok imho
ok I will see if Rhythmbox spits anything out into the terminal, then I will look into other methods of retagging...
nothing unusual happened in terminal... All I am trying to do is change a word from all uppercase to lowercase...
well.. give easytag a go.. see if can do it
it is weird, because it looks like it has worked when I do it in Rhythmbox, then exactly 3 seconds later, it reverts back to the old uppercase version.
I've never had that happen to me.. although I've never used rhythmbox so it might be some kind of bug/feature ..
I have dicovered something even more bizarre.. those two files, now say the correct tags when viewed in easytag, but when opened in Rhythmbox, they have reverted to the old tags....
perhaps one of the programs is using v1 and the other one is using v2 of the id3 tagging system?
oh.. ask ilovefairuz just said.. =)
ilovefairuz - well according to the prefs in easytag, it is set to write both ID3v1 and ID3v2 tags by default.... so I can't work out why RB is still showing up the old tags....

perhaps it's got the tags cached so it doesn't need to read them every time it boots up.. isn't there a "refresh my music library" option? perhaps rename the file slightly so it thinks it's a new file?
